name: TheAtlantic
text: “I hear the door close. I turn around. And he’s right at me, pushing me against the wall.” The journalist @Tashka9 says she was assaulted by Donald Trump during a 2005 interview at Mar-a-Lago. This is her story: https://t.co/RWK8lcKXfb

name: TheAtlantic
text: Dozens of women have accused Donald Trump of ogling, grabbing, groping, mauling, or raping them. Who are they? Why did they decide to tell their stories, and what has life been like since? Read the first installment of our new series: https://t.co/66iE8ldt5w

name: TheAtlantic
text: For the first time since the pandemic's early days in the U.S., a new movie has opened in theaters nationwide. Unfortunately, it's not a very good one—but it's the best Hollywood can do now as cinemas slowly reopen, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/e5KTT6kfbA

name: TheAtlantic
text: A new iteration of the "Why I'm Leaving New York" essay has arisen, tilted toward pandemic concerns, but nevertheless imbued with class privilege. @talmonsmith reports on the still-bustling city and the loyalists who remain: https://t.co/V9S7wSx6ok

name: TheAtlantic
text: A speaker for the Republican convention was removed from last night's lineup after retweeting a thread that promoted “The Protocols of the Elders of Zion.” Steven J. Zipperstein explains why this anti-Semitic conspiracy text has survived for so long: https://t.co/XXa4HFaACE

name: TheAtlantic
text: The strategies on display in the Belarus protests are emblematic of a global trend, writes @YasmeenSerhan, in which a grassroots movement in one country adopts the best practices of others: https://t.co/HAmBNe8tu1

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mimbsy: "Will Mike Pence—and the religious right—be rewarded for their embrace of Donald Trump?" @mckaycoppins profiled the vice president in 2018: https://t.co/CBZ6GRitge

name: TheAtlantic
text: The RNC is terrified of losing women voters, @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/IX4ayzyJS5

name: TheAtlantic
text: In protesting against police brutality by refusing to participate in last night’s playoff game, the Milwaukee Bucks have embarked on perhaps the most monumental work stoppage in the history of any major American sport, @MichaelWeinreb writes: https://t.co/95PiY15slo

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: The Vatican recently opened its secret archives from the World War II-era to researchers. For the first time, Pulitzer Prize-winning historian David Kertzer reveals what was hiding in those documents from the tenure of Pope Pius XII: https://t.co/mq9GltEb4C

name: TheAtlantic
text: GOP leaders sold a female-friendly version of Donald Trump at the convention, despite dark parts of the president’s history, @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/5c4Mtqcqvu

name: TheAtlantic
text: The GOP's apocalyptic rhetoric this week loudly echoes a conservative call to arms during the 2016 election, @RonBrownstein writes. It's the Flight 93 convention. https://t.co/vXoU9lUVdX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @emersongreg: Impressive lineup at this year's (FREE) @TheAtlanticFest - @DrIbram @theebillyporter @staceyabrams Dr. Fauci @aliciagarza the list goes on and on. Register > https://t.co/0dledGHkZG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Making friends at work can be hard when you're in charge. @arthurbrooks writes on the plight of the lonely boss, and how to forge intentional connections off the job. https://t.co/MJmyhRwvB9

name: TheAtlantic
text:
People all across Belarus have marched in remarkably peaceful and coordinated protests with few leaders visible. How did everyone know what to do?

The answer, improbably, is a 22-year-old blogger, who lives outside the country, @anneapplebaum reports: https://t.co/hoKNiOEyst

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: The GOP's apocalyptic rhetoric this week loudly echoes a Michael Anton's call to arms during the 2016 election, @RonBrownstein writes. This is the Flight 93 convention. https://t.co/VlpvQARY2I

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump is using the RNC to show the nation what he has learned over the past four years: the power of impunity," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/GvzyY7rOnh

name: TheAtlantic
text: Newly discovered documents reveal the private discussions behind both the Vatican’s silence about the Nazi deportation of Rome’s Jews and its support for the kidnapping of two Jewish boys whose parents had died in the Holocaust, @DavidKertzer reports. https://t.co/ATln3u0iBF

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If there was ever a time for Black players to leverage their talent to promote change, it’s now. They’ve tried to sweet-talk America into caring about racial injustice, but that hasn’t worked," @jemelehill writes: https://t.co/s7b43wKMlZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This is a really big deal. “What was not known at the time... is the central role that the Vatican and the pope himself played in the kidnapping drama.” https://t.co/OZcdPQUAf7

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Funding for Alzheimer's research lagged for decades. Now, funding is up and experts say the potential avenues for treatment are more diverse than they’ve ever been. @alzassociation https://t.co/F3CHEahILO

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: "These NBA players, in the midst of the strangest culmination of a season in the league’s history, have embarked on perhaps the most monumental work stoppage in the history of any major American sport." https://t.co/sMp2oBIMUg via @MichaelWeinreb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: "If Black NFL players followed the NBA players’ lead, a big chunk of the sports economy would be made contingent on racial progress,” writes @jemelehill https://t.co/QnOwSU9sNZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As bad as the pandemic is, the city has seen more terrible days: in the Great Depression, in the draft riots of the Civil War—even in the Revolution, when a third of the city burned," @bakerauthor writes: https://t.co/qWDe8DecGj

name: TheAtlantic
text: "What military leaders understand—and those advocating for our military to use its popularity to wade into politics do not—is that once the military consents to become a political actor, the public will consider it one," @KoriSchake writes. https://t.co/wSfPrwZEza

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JaBogen: Join #TheAtlanticFest 2020 to hear from @HillaryClinton, @priyankachopra, @chefjoseandres, @ChrisEvans, @aliciagarza, and more. Registration is FREE and attendance is all-virtual! Going to be one hell of a thing, from September 21st through the 24th. https://t.co/6uHOtSJSaY

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hurricanes, wildfires, poisoned air, treacherous winds. How long, @yayitsrob asks, until the late summer and early fall is known as a time of disaster?https://t.co/soxJYAvdGy

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @julietlapidos: The pandemic couldn't have killed NYC because affluence already killed it https://t.co/VripmrHAKb

name: TheAtlantic
text: If it seems like there's a new viral video every day of a grown-up throwing a tantrum, writes @kait_tiffany, that's because there is. https://t.co/X8RjkeJWkW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: The Aftermath of Hurricane Laura via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/CrBIvpI4qP

name: TheAtlantic
text: The killings in Kenosha represent a grave turning point in the fight over police violence, reports @elainejgodfrey. https://t.co/nqJSlZILFK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Newly discovered documents reveal the private discussions behind both the Vatican’s silence about the Nazi deportation of Rome’s Jews and its support for the kidnapping of two Jewish boys whose parents had died in the Holocaust, @DavidKertzer reports. https://t.co/b10ZMxYTSe

text: The killings in Kenosha represent a grave turning point in the fight over police violence, reports @elainejgodfrey. https://t.co/blMeEKBU2o
